results.title: The Concept and principles of functional drafting
results.creator_credit: Industrial Education Films and Majestic Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: This film is designed to demonstrate to the new person “on the board” as well as the experienced draftsman or designer, what functional drafting can do, mentioning saving in time and cost and improvement in actual drawings. Points out the advantages and some examples of functional drafting. States the basic principles involved in this simplified form of drafting.

results.title: Con motto
results.brief_description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.
results.description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.

results.title: Computers in the seventies
results.brief_description: This film takes a pre-micro-chip look at computer development to the 1970s providing a short historical background and then examining contemporary computer development in meteorology, records storage, aviation and building design, and medical procedures. Touches on contemporary times with “suspicion”.

results.title: A Computer glossary, or, coming to terms with the data processing machine
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames, Bill Lightfield, Richard Spies and IBM
results.brief_description: Beginning with a journey along a computer data path, this films uses a variety of visual techniques to illustrate terms such as software, program, flow, subroutine, mnemonic, language, boolean logic, nanosecond, simulation, pattern recognition and algorithm. Emphasises the challenge of computer programming that emerges from its precisely defined procedures. Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: Compulsive car thief
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: Presents the case history of a 21-year-old prison inmate who has been stealing cars and getting caught since he was 10 years old, pointing out that his behaviour has continued to baffle his parents, and the court. Poses the question: is the psychopath a medical or legal problem?

results.title: A Composition in steel by Todd Pendleton with Jack Pendleton
results.creator_credit: James Klebau and James Klebau Productions
results.brief_description: The film shows the two Pendleton brothers, Todd and Jack, making a steel sculpture starting from the initial design in chalk on a metal base, then the selection, cutting and the beating of the scrap metal to shape. Finally they weld the shapes together modifying the design as they go.

results.title: Complex waves: propagation evanescence and stability (TEFC)
results.brief_description: James Mecher at Massachusetts Institute of Technology uses springs to demonstrate the waves equation and then develops this concept to show how it relates to the study of electromagnetic fields and forces as they interact with moving and deformable media.

results.title: The Compleat schooling
results.creator_credit: Rupert Glover, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Freyberg Memorial School, in Te Atatu, near Auckland, has become an important community centre. Teachers and parents have extended the school’s function to make it an exciting place where adults and youngsters are involved in many activities outside the mainstream of education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rupert Glover, David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: The Compenius Organ in Denmark
results.creator_credit: Christen Jul, Dansk Kulturfilm and Nordisk Films Kompagni
results.brief_description: At Frederiksborg Palace is the famous organ constructed in wood by Esaias Compenius of Brunswick. Kept in working order since 1610, it is a living witness to the love of music which enriched the reign of Christian IV. In the film, the music of Buxtehude (who had considerable influence on J.S. Bach) brings out many of its unique beauties. Tapestries by Hans Kneiper, included in the film, illustrate daily life of the 17th century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christen Jul, Dansk Kulturfilm and Nordisk Films Kompagni

results.title: A Company of Men
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Focuses attention on the more delicate question of the prejudices and resistance which may be encountered at all levels when Work Study is introduced into industry. The story is based on the day-to-day record of a six-months period in an engineering firm in the Midlands, and is presented as a realistic account of the difficulties experienced and overcome, in an effort to bring fundamental problems into open discussion.
